summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 29, 2020, requesting assistance for Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) with the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation. It highlights the case's high-profile nature and the need for help with evidence and discovery work.

persons.name: SA New York Field Office
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office expresses enthusiasm to help with the C-20 (Epstein/Maxwell) investigation, despite being on temporary duty in Albuquerque, and inquires about remote opportunities.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: A Supervisory Special Agent in the FBI's New York Office sends the initial request for assistance for Squad C-20 and is copied on responses.

connections.description: SA responds to SSA's request for assistance on the Epstein/Maxwell case, indicating a professional reporting or collaborative relationship within the FBI.
SA is designated as the point of contact for the assistance request initiated by SSA, indicating a supervisory or team coordination relationship.

events.title: FBI Request for Assistance on Epstein/Maxwell Case
events.description: The FBI's Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) circulates an internal request for assistance with the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, specifically for help with evidence and discovery work.

keyFacts: The FBI's Squad C-20, focused on VCAC/HT (likely Violent Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking), was actively seeking assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
The needed assistance was primarily for in-office work on evidence and discovery, expected to last for several months.
The case was described internally as a 'high profile case' and a 'unique opportunity' for agents.
The communication shows the investigation was ongoing and required significant manpower for evidence processing.
